item.title: Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater Releases August 28 on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/metal-gear-solid-delta-snake-eater-releases-august-28-on-playstation-5-xbox-series-xs-and-pc/

As showcased in the State of Play yesterday, Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater has an official release date of August 28, 2025. This title will be available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and Steam. For those in EMEA (Europe, the Middle East, and Africa) you are already able to pre-order this title on your chosen platform, with some differences in the editions that are available.

Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater is set to be a faithful remake of Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater, an iconic game that was originally released in 2004 for the PlayStation 2. However, with a new generation being introduced to Solid Snake, as well as loyal fans wanting more Metal Gear Solid action, a remake was the perfect way to introduce newcomers to the franchise. The remake will star the original English and Japanese voice actors, with a rich and intense storyline and some new expansive features of the combat system with brand-new graphics and immersive sound.

If you are yet to see the trailer, here is what you missed from last night's State of Play.

This particular trailer is for the PlayStation 5 and Steam version of the game, with Xbox having a slightly different trailer available. This is due to the return of Snake vs. Monkey, which is a fan-favorite game that will be making a return on PlayStation and Steam at launch, with more information to come about Snake vs. Monkey for the Xbox Series X|S version of the game later down the line.

If you know that you plan on getting this game, pre-orders are already open in EMEA, as stated above. There are multiple editions available, with some of the editions providing you with DLC that can give you some extra cosmetics to play with.

The Digital Deluxe Edition and Physical Deluxe Edition will both include the Sneaking DLC Pack, as well as players getting access to the game 48 hours earlier with the Digital Deluxe Edition. The Sneaking DLC includes:

  • Uniform - Battle Dress (METAL GEAR SOLID: PEACE WALKER version)
  • Uniform - Sneaking suit (METAL GEAR SOLID: PEACE WALKER version)
  • Uniform - Crocodile suit
  • Uniform - Naked (Woodland)
  • Uniform - Naked (Naked Ammunition Belt)
  • Uniform - Gold
  • Face - Glasses
  • Face - Sunglasses
  • Equipment - Kerotan mask
  • Equipment – GA-KO mask

The physical edition includes:

  • METAL GEAR SOLID Δ: SNAKE EATER Day One Edition
  • Exclusive SteelBook® Case
  • Metal Keyring
  • 5 Art Cards
  • FOX iron-on Fabric Patch
  • Custom Packaging

For those diehard Metal Gear fans, the Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater Collector's Pack comes in custom packaging and will include:

  • METAL GEAR SOLID Δ: SNAKE EATER Snake ELITE BUST (1/4 Scale Statue Bust)
  • METAL GEAR SOLID Δ: SNAKE EATER Original Vinyl Soundtrack

item.title: Metal Eden, New FPS from Reikon Games, Launches on May 6
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/metal-eden-new-fps-from-reikon-games-launches-on-may-6/

During Sony's latest State of Play, Metal Eden was announced. This is a new FPS title from Reikon Games. The developers of Ruiner showcased their new and upcoming FPS title, Metal Eden. Published by Deep Silver, the game will be coming to PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S on May 6, 2025. If you missed the trailer from the State of Play last night, you can check it out below and experience the high-octane reveal for yourself.

Metal Eden is a sci-fi FPS title where you get to explore a world where humanity's consciousness is no longer being held in captivity in the flesh and now resides within robots. There will be eight missions for you to make your way through, with a handcrafted universe to explore. This game will see you plunged into an artificial world full of cybernetic warfare, where you'll be given the opportunity to take control of a hyper unit while also exploring the world and uncovering the mysteries of the futuristic world before you.

In Metal Eden, you take on the role of ASKA, which is an advanced Hyper Unit android that has been built around a digitized human psyche. The architecture in the world around you is bathed in neon lights, helping to immerse you into the cyber-futuristic world in front of you, which has been named Moebius. As you explore Moebius, you will find yourself participating in the ongoing conflict over the souls of a lost human colony that are stored in cybernetic COREs.

On this journey, you are accompanied by your sentient spaceship named Nexus. As you progress through the story, you will expand and upgrade your arsenal, as well as make your robotic body even stronger and more robust to be able to continue fighting off enemies in a mechanical world. By fighting the diverse roster of enemies, you will have to extract energy cores that will provide you with an advantage on the battlefield. Along with upgrading your weaponry, you'll also get to upgrade and obtain new combat abilities that will make you a force of nature.

If you like parkour in your games, you'll want to keep an eye on Metal Eden, as you are able to dash, grapple, and wall-run your way through Moebius while taking on enemies in intense encounters.

Metal Eden will be released on PC, Xbox Series X|S, and PlayStation 5 on May 6, 2025.

item.title: GTA Creator’s ‘MindsEye’ Game Slated to Launch This Summer
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/gta-creators-mindseye-game-slated-to-launch-this-summer/

After several months of quiet, developer Build a Rocket Boy shared a new gameplay trailer for MindsEye, their story-driven action/adventure thriller game, during yesterday's State of Play broadcast. They also revealed that the game will be released this Summer on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series S|X, published by IO Interactive.

Leslie Benzies, Game Director of MindsEye and former producer on GTA III, Vice City, San Andreas, GTA IV, and GTA V, said in a statement:

I’ve dedicated my entire career to crafting captivating interactive entertainment to delight players. With MindsEye, we’ve pushed cinematic adventure to the next level - building characters and a world that feels truly alive. We can’t wait for players to step in and feel the immersive realism and tireless effort poured into every moment of the game.

MindsEye is developed with the same technology that powers Everywhere, the studio's ambitious user generated content (UGC) platform. In this game, players will become Jacob Diaz, who has received a mysterious neural implant (the titular MindsEye) which has left him with disjointed flashbacks of his time in the service.

Set in Redrock, a fictional desert metropolis in the not-too-distant future, MindsEye tells a story of artificial intelligence, human greed, and the struggle for control that has brought the Earth to the brink of collapse. Players will explore a richly detailed world, uncovering hidden conspiracies while navigating a deeply personal and high-stakes narrative.

MindsEye delivers intense combat where every decision is critical to survival. Players will engage in third-person shooter encounters, facing enemies that coordinate attacks, flush them from cover, and swarm with overwhelming force. Success depends on quick thinking, tactical positioning, and using the environment and a companion drone to gain the upper hand. There are also 'thrilling' high-speed chases that will push the player's driving skills to the limit, taking Jacob through a variety of environments, such as bustling cityscapes, remote industrial sites, trailer parks, and deserts. You can now wishlist the game on Steam.

item.title: GeForce NOW to Add WB Games Titles, Starting with Batman Arkham Series
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/geforce-now-to-add-wb-games-titles-starting-with-batman-arkham-series/

Today, NVIDIA announced that Warner Bros. Games is returning to GeForce NOW with its games. As you might recall, the publisher was one of many who asked NVIDIA to remove their games from the service when it left beta five years ago. Now that GeForce NOW is celebrating its fifth anniversary, Warner Bros. Games titles will come back to the cloud platform, starting with Rocksteady's acclaimed Batman Arkham series.

Here's the full list of GeForce NOW additions scheduled for this week:

● Sid Meier’s Civilization VII (New release on Steam and Epic Games Store, Feb. 11)
● Legacy: Steel & Sorcery (New release on Steam, Feb. 12)
● F1 Manager 2024 (New release on Epic Games Store, Free Feb. 13)
● Tomb Raider IV-VI Remastered (New release on Steam, Feb. 14)
● Batman: Arkham Asylum - Game of the Year Edition (Steam and Epic Games Store)
● Batman: Arkham City - Game of the Year Edition (Steam and Epic Games Store)
● Batman: Arkham Knight (Steam and Epic Games Store)

The remaining GeForce NOW lineup for February can be found below:

● Avowed (New release on Steam, Battle.net and Xbox, available on PC Game Pass, Feb. 18)
● Lost Records: Bloom & Rage (New release on Steam, Feb. 18)
● Abiotic Factor (Steam)
● Alan Wake (Xbox, available on the Microsoft Store)
● Ashes of the Singularity: Escalation (Xbox, available on the Microsoft Store)
● The Dark Crystal: Age of Resistance Tactics (Xbox, available on the Microsoft Store)
● HUMANITY (Steam)
● Murky Divers (Steam)
● Somerville (Xbox, available on the Microsoft Store)
● Songs of Silence (Steam)
● UNDER NIGHT IN-BIRTH II Sys:Celes (Steam)
